snippet: Vuk Jeremic, the General Assembly president, denied that he had organized the event to try to discredit the war crimes tribunal for the former Yugoslavia.
abstract: Serbia’s former foreign minister Vuk Jeremic, who is current president of United Nations General Assembly, strikes back at critics of meeting he organized on role of international criminal justice, denying their assertions that it was ruse to discredit war crimes tribunal for former Yugoslavia; United States, Canada and Jordan boycotted meeting.
lead_paragraph: Vuk Jeremic, the General Assembly president, denied that he had organized the event to try to discredit the war crimes tribunal for the former Yugoslavia.

headline.seo: Serb Defends U.N. Meeting on Criminal Justice
headline.main: Serb Defends U.N. Meeting Boycotted by the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Serb Defends U.N. Meeting Boycotted By the U.S.

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
